bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Walker et al. Memo from Judge
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: Territory of Washington Pierce County} ss
To the Sheriff and the Keeper of the Jail in said County--

Whereas M.A. Walker of Tacoma in said County has been brought this day before the undersigned one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County-charged by a Coroners Jury with having on the Mornunes of the 16th day of July A.D. 1885 in said County Purposely, Deliberately, Premeditatedly, and Unlawfully killed one William Lockwood, and in the progress of the examination of said charge, it appearing to said Justice that the said M.A. Walker has been guilty of the offense as charged. Therefore you the said Sheriff are commsuded in the name of the United States forthwith to convey and deliver the said M.A Walker to the said keeper: and you the said keeper are hereby commanded to receive the said M.A. Walker into your custody in said Jail and him There safely keep until he be discharged by due course of law-
Given under my hand this 23d day of July A.D. 1885
Alex Campbell Justice of the Peace
